module.name: edge_based_wireframe
module.purpose: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to support the requirement to represent the product shape using three-dimensional wireframe models that are bounded by a set of connected edge sets.

inscope.li: the representation of wireframe models that are described by a graph of edges and vertices where the edges intersect only at their vertices;
the representation of a wireframe model by one or more connected edge sets that shall not overlap or intersect except at their vertices or edges;
points defined in a three-dimensional coordinate space;
curves, including b-splines, defined in a three-dimensional coordinate space;
the representation of a single wireframe model or an assembly of wireframe models.

outscope.li: geometry defined in a two-dimensional coordinate space;

uof.name: Edge_Based_Wireframe
uof.description: The Edge_Based_Wireframe UoF specifies the definitional information for the concept of representing a wireframe model described by a graph of edges/vertices as a consistent set of geometric and topological entities. The shapes represented by the edge_based_wireframe_shape_representation are those with definitions that only require collections of edges. Wireframe representations may be assemblies of other wireframe representations that are mapped to the same coordinate space.
